revised_title: Quantitative Analysis of Incomplete Color Blindness
tldr: The author presents a simple test to measure the amount of green and red sensations in incomplete color-blind eyes compared to a normal eye. The test uses a chromate solution to match the hue of white light and determine the ratio of red to green sensations. This method allows for accurate and delicate quantification of color sensation deviations, providing valuable insights into color blindness and the trichromatic theory of color vision.
